snippet: Sheikh Ali Salman, secretary general of Al Wefaq, who had made speeches seeking reform, was convicted of inciting hatred and insulting institutions.
abstract: Bahrain's court sentences opposition leader Sheikh Ali Salman to four years in prison for publicly inciting hatred and insulting public institutions; Salman was arrested December 2014 after calling openly for political reform.
lead_paragraph: Sheikh Ali Salman, secretary general of Al Wefaq, who had made speeches seeking reform, was convicted of inciting hatred and insulting institutions.

headline.main: Bahrain Opposition Leader Sentenced to 4 Years in Prison
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Bahrain: Opposition Leader Sentenced
